articles.title: Watch: Sen. Josh Hawley defends his actions on January 6, including fist pump - CNN Video
articles.description: In an interview with CNN's Manu Raju, Sen. Josh Hawley (R-MO) defends his actions on the day of the January 6 insurrection.

articles.author: Nicole Goodkind, CNN Business
articles.title: Fed makes history with second massive rate hike in as many months
articles.description: What seemed unfathomable just six months ago -- a 75-basis-point rate hike by the Federal Reserve -- has now happened twice in a row.

articles.author: Kevin Liptak, Betsy Klein and Kate Sullivan, CNN
articles.title: Biden 'feeling great' and back to work in person after testing negative for Covid-19
articles.description: President Joe Biden said Wednesday he's "feeling great" and is back to working in person after isolating in the White House and recovering from what has been described as a mild case of Covid-19.

articles.title: 'I don't want to go bankrupt': High inflation leaves little room for unexpected costs - CNN Video
articles.description: CNN's Natasha Chen reports from California on what some Americans struggling with high inflation are doing to make ends meet.

articles.title: How to take advantage of rising interest rates
articles.description: In anticipation of the Federal Reserve's next interest rate hike -- which would be its fourth since March -- consumers again will face new choices in where to park their money for the most yield and how best to minimize their borrowing costs.

articles.title: Opinion: The toughest part of the Fed's job may already be done
articles.description: If households and businesses maintain the view that inflation will return to 2% in the not-too-distant future, the Fed's task in accomplishing that outcome will be much easier.

articles.title: The stock market is practically begging for a recession

articles.title: Latest moves suggest DOJ investigation of 2020 election is looking at conduct directly related to Trump and his closest allies
articles.description: The move by the Justice Department to bring two top aides to former Vice President Mike Pence in front of a federal grand jury is the most aggressive public step taken yet by prosecutors investigating the plots to subvert the 2020 election.
